availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Young H. Doan (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and confederate sympathizer )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin Doan and Mary Doan. Married to Nancy Doan. Father of Frances Doan, Mary Doan, Elizabeth Doan, Burk Doan, John Doan, Lucretia Doan, Margaret Doan, George H. Doan, Nannie M. Doan, and Sarah H. Doan. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Arrested as a confederate sympathizer in Harrison County on July 15, 1862. Imprisoned from July 17, 1862, to November 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 103B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 614-15.
U.S. Civil War Prisoner of War Records, 1861-1865, NARA RG 249, Microfilm Series M598, War Department Collection of Confederate Records, p. 148.
